subject: Education
title: Validity: Does the Test Measure What It Claims?
description: A short lesson to help you apply Validity: Does the Test Measure What It Claims?.

hook.text: A math test full of word problems might measure reading ability more than math skill.

buildup.text: Validity asks: does this assessment actually measure the knowledge or skill it's supposed to?

discovery.text: Content validity, construct validity, and predictive validity are three key types to check.

twist.text: A test can be perfectly reliable (consistent results) but completely invalid (measuring the wrong thing).

climax.text: High-stakes decisions based on invalid tests affect millions of students' futures.

punchline.text: A consistent wrong answer is still wrong.
